attributes.action: CHANGE IN THE PRESENT BUSINESS RATE CHARGES TO SMALL BUSINESSESS
attributes.additional_details: The present system of charges levied on Small Businesses for their Uniformed Business Rate’s is totally unfair to small businesses, as the one man band shop, - say that of a baker or shoe repairman, has to pay the exact same Business Rates, as that of the multi-chained companies, like Greggs the Baker’s, Clark’s Shoes or Boots the chemist, - as businesses only get ‘relief’ according to the rateable value of the property.  So how this presently works-out, on your typical high street, you will, or I should say, you should or one might of once have seen – small one man band businesses in one shop and right next door to a multi chained conglomerate, such as those companies just quoted above, and whom are paying the very same business rates and rents as the one man band, this can't be fair, and would like the government to take some action in regards to this matter.
